item.title: Report E-2024050349
item.description:
Report E-2024050349

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: GAINESVILLE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LOGISTICS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 17205
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering diesel fuel into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, the connection between the hose and storage tank became compromised. This allowed approximately 50 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2024050330
item.description:
Report E-2024050330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: CORDELE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 9, 2024, two (2) 330-gallon totes of UN3266 had damaged caps and released approximately one (1) ounce of product to the surface of the totes. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. Crews replaced both caps on the two (2) totes and verified the seals. AOTC used a baking soda solution and absorbent pads to clean and neutralize the impacted tote surfaces. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket and staged onsite for disposal.
